channel.title: paper on Hexgolems
channel.description: Recent content in paper on Hexgolems

item.title: Aurora
item.description: Aurora automatically identifies the root cause of bugs found via fuzzing. Published at USENIX Security 2020

item.title: EthBMC
item.description: A bounded model checker for smart contracts, that can steal money. Published at USENIX Security 2020

item.title: Ijon
item.description: Allows the user to guide the fuzzer through the state space of the target program. Published at Oakland S&P 2020

item.title: Antifuzz
item.description: Investigate weak points in current fuzzers to protect software from fully automatic fuzzing. Published at USENIX Security 2019

item.title: Grimoire
item.description: Automatically infer grammar like fragments during normal feedback fuzzing to improve test coverage. Published at USENIX Security 2019.

item.title: Nautilus - Fuzzing with Grammars
item.description: An AFL style feedback fuzzer, that uses grammars to find more bugs. Written in Rust and published at NDSS 2019

item.title: Redqueen
item.description: A binary fuzzer that automatically solves magic Bytes and checksums during fuzzing. Published at NDSS 2019.

item.title: Syntia
item.description: Uses program synthesis to deobfuscate VM instruction handlers used by obfuscators such as VMProtect and Themida. Published at USENIX Security 2017.

item.title: kAFL
item.description: An AFL style feedback fuzzer, that uses Intel-PT to trace operating systems without access to sourcecode. Published at USENIX Security 2017
